org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: Evidence on the inquest upon the body of Wm Lockwood JUly 16th 1885. Residence E. St. between 19th & 21 sts.

H.F. McKay: night Poliemna: sworn. testified that at about 2.30 am upon the morning of July 16th '85: was informed that a man had been run over by the cars at 26th St: Mr Kirkbride informed me: I immediately summoned the Coroner: went with Coroner & Linquish to where the body lay: found body laying between raids and next to North rail of track: was laying face downward with right arm and left foot upon track: left hand was under the deceased head: his face was turned toward the appoximate rail: I have seen deceased in an intoxicated condition several times and have awakened him from sleep when in that condition upon the sidewalk: think deceased was in the habit of carrying whiskey: have seen flasks of that liquor upon his person: the mans name is Wm Lockwood: he plays in Hany Morgans establishment:
Had widently been run over by cares: heeped Coroner him remains over: body was brought to town by switch engine: was a litle store and in front of Mr Walkers house where accident occurred.

JW Kirkbride: Brakesman: sworn: testifies: that did not see man before he was run over: was on our which switch engine was hauling up to slaughter house with stock: when than stopped got off and found man we held a consultation where it was determined that I should return to city and notify authorities and the remainder of train hands should furnish contemplated work: met Mr McKay who went and notified Coroner while I returned to
